page.title: 04ATCHAM VILLAGE
page.content: { Until recent reorganization ATCHAM was the name of a large rural district.Now it hardly qualifies as a village.Along one edge of the village runs the busy A5 taking traffic from N.Wales to London. The{MYTTON AND MERMAID}hotel is a red brick Georgian building formerly the Dower house of the Berwick family. Atcham has two bridges-a new one to take modern traffic which was built next to John Gwynne's l8th C.structure now only used by pedestrians. The{VILLAGE HALL}was an old MALTHOUSE used for grinding barley and has retained some fine old beams.It was given to the village as a W.W.1. memorial by Lord Berwick. Each Spring a{DAFFODIL WALK}takes place to raise money for St.Eatas.
